message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the capacity of neural networks, specifically Hopfield networks, which are commonly used in the field of neural networks. Therefore, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses learning techniques and strategies, which falls under cs.LG (Machine Learning). The use of multilevel inputs and the examination of network scalability suggest that the paper could also be categorized under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the examination of the ability to recall entire patterns from stimulation of a single neuron suggests that the paper could also be categorized under cs.IT (Information Theory).
